body:
```
$ cat /etc/*-release | grep \^NAME; python --version; cython --version    
NAME="Arch Linux"
Python 3.5.2
Cython version 0.24.1
```
```
$ cat foo.pyx && cythonize -b foo.pyx >/dev/null && python -c 'import foo; foo.main()'
from libc cimport float as flt_lib
def main():
    print(flt_lib.FLT_EPSILON)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "foo.pyx", line 3, in foo.main (/tmp/foo/foo.c:682)
    print(flt_lib.FLT_EPSILON)
AttributeError: type object 'float' has no attribute 'FLT_EPSILON'
```
Trying to just do `from libc cimport float` results in a similar error, but I can understand that it is not obvious what "float" refers to (Well, Python does allow shadowing builtin names, but that's probably a bad idea for Cython).  Here however it should be clear that `flt_lib` refers to `libc.float` not the type.

(Initially reported (a while ago) on cython-users.)
title: Invalid resolution of aliased cimported name that maps to a type name
